issue.title: make throws "clang: error: no input files"
issue.body:
Using Mac OSX 10.14.6 (Mojave):

```
$ ./autogen.sh 
glibtoolize: putting auxiliary files in AC_CONFIG_AUX_DIR, 'build-aux'.
glibtoolize: copying file 'build-aux/ltmain.sh'

```


```
$ make
  CC       src/bench_verify-bench_verify.o
clang: error: no input files
/bin/sh: /usr/local/opt/gettext/include: is a directory
make: *** [src/bench_verify-bench_verify.o] Error 126
```

events.body: Could you please try adding gettext to your PATH? https://unix.stackexchange.com/a/387362/362986

Gettext isn't used by this library. It looks like its failing because something has put junk in your CPPFLAGS.

Try running

```shell
unset CPPFLAGS
unset LDFLAGS
```

Then rerun configure.

> Gettext isn't used by this library. It looks like its failing because something has put junk in your CPPFLAGS.

I assumed it is used by autoconf somehow and that the CPPFLAGS/LDFLAGS there are an attempt to "fix" this. 
but it doesn't make much sense, so you're probably right

This was interesting... gettext was definitely in my PATH as it is used by another application. I did the brew unlink and link of gettext and re-ran, still didn't work. Then I unset the CPPFLAGS and LDFLAGS and this did run successfully. Kind of odd, but glad that it resolved this. Thank you for the replies.

> Kind of odd, but glad that it resolved this. 

Ignoring the fact that we don't need gettext, what happened here is that the `-I` and `-L` parameters are in the wrong format. You can't separate directories by semicolon, you simply need to pass multiple `-I` or `-L`. The semicolon was interpreted by your shell as the end of the shell command and then 1) clang complained that it was not passed any input files (because the shell command string was terminated to early and 2) the shell tried to execute  `/usr/local/opt/gettext/include`, which is the next thing after the semicolon, as the next command but this is a directory and as such not executable
Ah, great catch, thanks for the explanation 👍
